channel.title: Investoradio - The Sound of Money
channel.description:
From some of the people who brought you Money Magazine’s “Best Money Podcast of 2008,” Sound Investing - comes an exciting new program, Investoradio, devoted to giving you the tools and knowledge you need to save, manage, and invest your money more effectively. Every week on Investoradio, broadcast and financial professionals, Don McDonald and Tom Cock will help you navigate the treacherous financial waters. You’ll discover who is working for you and against you. You’ll learn which investments make your broker richer and those that are likely to do more for your bottom line.

Some of the greatest minds in the financial business join Tom and Don to help you make more sense of your money and blaze a path to better future. On any given program you can expect to hear from the likes of Vanguard’s John Bogle, Jason Zweig from the Wall Street Journal, or Michelle Singletary of the Washington Post.

Investoradio will help you steer clear of the sharks and plot a course toward a brighter financial future.

item.title: Investoradio for 08/14/11
item.description:
How do you deal with the volatility in the investing markets? We share our thoughts on some of the typical responses. Author Larry Swedroe explains “liquidity risk.” We are joined by economist Bill Conerly who has a realistic take on America’s future economic performance. Finally, we share a heartwarming tale from Comedy Central’s “The Daily Show” about a couple who turn the tables on a foreclosing bank. Plus, we cram in a ton of additional information designed to help you join our “Investing Revolution.”

The best way to download Investoradio and subscribe to every show is via iTunes.

item.title: Investoradio for 07/09/11
item.description:
A very special show. First, while it doesn’t mean a lot, the second quarter was good to investors. Larry Swedroe shares “A Tale of Two Strategies.” We explore just how often most financial experts actually agree with our advice. Just listen to Tim Buckley from Vanguard and Forbes columnist, Ken Fisher. Then Kelly Campbell tells us why you should fire your broker. Plus, much more. A whole lot of great investing info in a mere 39 minutes.

The best way to download Investoradio and subscribe to every show is via iTunes.
